item.title: 法国央行行长警告不要扩大国家赤字
item.description: 法国央行行长弗朗索瓦-维勒鲁瓦-德-加尔豪（François Villeroy de Galhau）在各政党争相组建法国下届政府之际警告说，法国不能再继续增加赤字，也不能再让企业承担更多的税收和成本。【原文：France cannot afford to keep increasing its deficit or burden its companies with more taxes and costs, Bank of France Governor François Villeroy de Galhau warned as political parties jostle to form the country’s next government.】

item.title: 瑞典长期通胀预期在调查中走高
item.description: Prospera 最新调查显示，由于央行开始降低借贷成本，瑞典长期通胀率预期略高于瑞典央行 2% 的目标。【原文：Expectations for Sweden’s long-term inflation rate rose slightly above the Riksbank’s 2% target as the central bank has started taking borrowing costs lower, the latest Prospera survey showed.】

item.title: 津巴布韦必须结束 "美元控制 "才能重获经济主权
item.description: 新闻秘书尼克-曼格瓦纳（Nick Mangwana）说，津巴布韦必须采取必要措施，结束对美元的依赖，增加本国货币的使用。【原文：Zimbabwe must take the necessary steps to end its reliance on the dollar and increase the use of its own currency, Information Secretary Nick Mangwana said.】

item.title: 泰晤士河水务公司接受英国监管机构的特别监督
item.description: 根据监管机构 Ofwat 周四制定的计划，英国最大的自来水和污水处理公司将被纳入特别措施体系，该公司可能被解散或在证券交易所上市。【原文：The UK’s biggest water and sewage company will be put into a special measures regime that could see the company broken up or listed on the stock exchange, under plans set out by the regulator Ofwat on Thursday.】

item.title: 罗马尼亚通胀降至 2021 年低点，为降息提供了空间
item.description: 罗马尼亚通胀率放缓至 2021 年以来的最低点，这为罗马尼亚央行在三年来首次降息后继续推行货币宽松政策提供了空间。【原文：Romanian inflation slowed to the lowest pace since 2021, boosting scope for the central bank to press ahead with monetary easing after the first cut to interest rates in three years.】

item.title: 英国 5 月经济增长 0.4%，比预期快一倍
item.description: 5 月份，英国经济复苏势头强劲，为工党新政府急于重振国家增长前景的努力提前注入了活力。【原文：The UK’s economic recovery gathered momentum in May, an early boost to the new Labour government as it rushes to revive the country’s growth prospects.】

item.title: 富时 100 指数直播：英国经济增速是预期的两倍
item.description: 通勤者经过伦敦金融城平方英里金融区的伦敦大火纪念碑。摄影师：克里斯-拉特克利夫/布鲁姆伯格【原文：Commuters pass The Monument to the great fire of London, in the square mile financial district of the City of London. Photographer: Chris Ratcliffe/Bloomberg】

item.title: 瑞典 Intrum 公司与债券持有人达成重组协议
item.description: 瑞典收债公司 Intrum AB 已与大多数债券持有人达成协议，以解决其 54 亿欧元（58 亿美元）的债务问题，包括迫使信贷投资者亏损和推迟票据到期日。【原文：Swedish debt collector Intrum AB has reached an agreement with a majority of its bondholders to address its €5.4 billion ($5.8 billion) debt pile, including a forced loss on credit investors and pushing out the notes’ maturities.】

item.title: 成田机场在日本燃油短缺的情况下接受进口燃油
item.description: 日本成田国际机场公司（Narita International Airport Corp.）决定接受进口航空燃油，以应对因需求激增而影响外国航空公司增加航班的航空燃油短缺问题。【原文：Japan’s Narita International Airport Corp. decided to accept imported jet fuel to deal with a shortage that has impacted foreign carriers seeking to increase flights as demand surges.】

item.title: 开始一天生活所需的五件事欧洲
item.description:
及时了解市场监测情况

Get up to speed with what the markets are monitoring

】

item.title: 瑞银称全球储备金管理者担心其资产面临风险
item.description: 瑞银集团（UBS Group AG）的一项调查显示，各国央行储备经理越来越担心其货币资产的安全性，理由是全球地缘政治风险不断上升。【原文：Central bank reserve managers are increasingly worried about the safety of their currency assets, citing rising geopolitical risk across the world, according to a UBS Group AG survey.】

item.title: 瑞银任命瑞士信贷前高级银行家为中国区副主席
item.description: 瑞银集团（UBS Group AG）任命瑞士信贷银行（Credit Suisse）前中国区主管 Janice Hu 为其在世界第二大经济体的证券合资企业的副董事长。【原文：UBS Group AG named Janice Hu, the former head of China for Credit Suisse, as vice chair of its securities venture in the world’s second-largest economy.】

item.title: 曼哈顿房客竞价战在激烈市场中创下新高
item.description: 6 月份，曼哈顿公寓市场的竞争力达到了新的水平。【原文：Manhattan’s apartment market reached new levels of competitiveness in June.】

item.title: 英国石油公司（BP）借来的时间必须改变--否则就得改变
item.description:
如果这家石油巨头的总部做出了全员响应，那么对于相关投资者而言，这一信息似乎就失去了意义。【原文：

If there’s an all-hands-on-deck response at the oil major’s headquarters, that message seems to be lost in translation for concerned investors.

】

item.title: 塞尔维亚在利率问题上的下一步行动让经济学家意见不一
item.description: 塞尔维亚持续的物价压力将与强劲的经济增长进行权衡，在央行三年多来首次降息后，经济学家对央行的下一步行动存在分歧。【原文：Lingering price pressure in Serbia will be weighed up against robust economic growth, with economists divided over the central bank’s next move following the first interest-rate cut in more than three years.】

item.title: 卡戴珊姐妹、迈克-泰森与商界巨头共同出席安巴尼婚礼
item.description: 经过数月的庆祝活动后，亚洲首富将于周五在印度举行一场奢华的家族婚礼，届时，从金-卡戴珊（Kim Kardashian）和克洛伊-卡戴珊（Khloe Kardashian）到拳击手迈克-泰森（Mike Tyson）等名人将与全球商界的一些大腕一起参加这场婚礼。【原文：Celebrities from Kim and Khloe Kardashian to boxer Mike Tyson are expected to join some of the biggest names in global business at a lavish family wedding thrown by Asia’s richest person, set to take place Friday in India after months of celebrations.】

item.title: 中国监管机构将要求部分银行降低债券风险
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，中国金融监管机构要求一些农村贷款机构缩短所持债券的平均期限，因为在债市持续反弹的情况下，当局正寻求保护银行业。【原文：China’s financial regulator asked some rural lenders to shorten the average duration of their bond holdings, according to people familiar with the matter, as authorities seek to safeguard the banking sector amid a relentless rally in the debt market.】

item.title: 印度股市将迎来现实检验，财报季拉开帷幕
item.description: 在交易日开始之前，我们为您带来可能影响市场的重要新闻和事件摘要。【原文：Before the trading day starts we bring you a digest of the key news and events that are likely to move markets.】

item.title: 中国基准利率在央行转向中成为濒危物种
item.description: 中国人民银行行长潘功胜上个月表示，中国政府正在研究改用短期利率来引导市场，这促使交易员和经济学家给现有的一年期基准利率贴上了濒危物种的标签。【原文：The People’s Bank of China’s Governor Pan Gongsheng last month said Beijing is studying shifting to a short-term rate to guide markets, spurring traders and economists to slap an endangered species tag on the existing one-year benchmark.】

item.title: 印度盈利势头降温将挑战股市狂热
item.description: 印度股票投资者期待一个强劲的盈利季节来证明昂贵的估值是合理的，但他们很可能会失望。【原文：Investors in Indian equities expecting a robust earnings season to justify expensive valuations are likely to be disappointed.】

item.title: 亚洲股市追随全球股市反弹，中国却落在后面：图表
item.description: 随着全球股市的持续上涨，亚洲的涨势主要集中在日本、印度、韩国和台湾。值得注意的是，中国缺席。中国。【原文：As global equity bulls enjoy the ongoing market rallies, Asia has seen its gains concentrated in Japan, India, South Korea and Taiwan. Notable by its absence? China.】

item.title: 日本地区贷款机构为市场招聘人员悬赏巨型银行薪酬
item.description: 总部位于日本最大岛屿西端的地区性贷款机构山口金融集团公司（Yamaguchi Financial Group Inc.【原文：Yamaguchi Financial Group Inc., a regional lender headquartered on the western tip of Japan’s biggest island, is considering paying new hires with securities market expertise around the same compensation as staff at the nation’s largest banks.】

item.title: 鲍威尔讲话引发降息预期，黄金保持涨势
item.description: 在美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔（Jerome Powell）向国会表示他认为通胀正在消退之后，交易员们认为美联储在 9 月份首次降息的可能性较高，因此黄金保持了连续两天的上涨。【原文：Gold held a two-day advance, with traders pricing in higher odds of an initial interest-rate cut from the Federal Reserve in September after Chair Jerome Powell told Congress he believes inflation is receding.】

item.title: 韩国央行对降息时间保持开放态度
item.description: 韩国央行周四维持基准利率不变，为降息奠定了基础，但对具体的降息时间仍持开放态度。【原文：The Bank of Korea laid the groundwork for an interest rate cut while leaving its options open over the specific timing, after leaving its benchmark interest rate unchanged Thursday.】

item.title: 因涉嫌管理不善，Redbox 所有者将被清算
item.description: Redbox Entertainment Inc.的律师和贷款人指控该公司前首席执行官管理不善，未能支付工人工资或为其健康福利提供资金，法官周三裁定，破产的 Redbox Entertainment Inc.所有者将被清算。【原文：The bankrupt owner of Redbox Entertainment Inc. will be liquidated, a judge ruled Wednesday, after lawyers for the company and lenders accused its former chief executive officer of mismanaging the business and failing to pay workers or fund their health benefits.】

item.title: 全球表现最好的航空公司股票战胜破产风险
item.description: 越南航空股份公司（Vietnam Airlines JSC）出人意料地恢复盈利，成为今年全球表现最好的航空股，摆脱了破产的风险，因为该公司在大流行病后的复苏终于获得了动力。【原文：A surprise return to profit has propelled Vietnam Airlines JSC to become the world’s best performing airline stock this year, shrugging off the risk of bankruptcy as the company’s post-pandemic recovery finally picks up momentum.】

item.title: 随着经济发展，印度需要 100 万名高科技工程师
item.description: 据一家行业机构估计，未来两三年内，印度科技行业将需要超过 100 万名掌握人工智能等先进技能的工程师，除非印度政府大力加强教育和培训，否则这一需求将无法得到满足。【原文：India’s technology sector will need more than 1 million engineers with advanced skills in artificial intelligence and other capabilities over the next 2-3 years, an industry body estimates, a demand that won’t be met unless the government significantly beefs up education and training in the country.】

item.title: 开始一天生活所需的五件事亚洲
item.description: 早上好S&P 500 指数首次突破 5600 点。谷歌母公司 Alphabet 放弃收购 HubSpot。中国收紧卖空规定。市场动态如下。【原文：Good morning. The S&P 500 tops 5,600 for the first time. Google parent Alphabet shelves efforts to acquire HubSpot. China tightens rules on short selling. Here’s what’s moving markets. — Isabelle Lee】

item.title: 美联储库克称美国数据与软着陆一致
item.description: 美联储理事丽莎-库克（Lisa Cook）说，虽然高通胀后经济软着陆的情况很少见，但她预测美国的情况也会如此，因为通胀降温对劳动力市场的损害很小。【原文：Federal Reserve Governor Lisa Cook said although soft landings in economies after bouts of high inflation are rare, that’s what she is predicting for the US as inflation cools with little damage to the labor market.】

item.title: 美国原油库存下降提振市场情绪，原油延续涨势
item.description: 石油连续第二天攀升，原因是需求增长的迹象和整个市场风险偏好的基调共同刺激了市场情绪。【原文：Oil climbed for a second day as signs of growing demand and a risk-on tone across broader markets combined to aid sentiment.】
